command.command:
# CHANGE THE FOLLOWING ADDRESS ACCORDING TO YOUR SERVER'S IP

IP_PULSE="@@PACKAGE_SERVER_PUBLIC_IP@@"

# =============================================================

# Mount network share for copying the drivers
net use \* \\\\${IP_PULSE}\\drivers /user:drivers s3cr3t
DRIVE_LETTER=`net use | grep drivers | grep OK | awk '{print $2}' | awk -F ':' '{print $1}'`
WINDOWS_FOLDER=`wmic os get Caption | sed -n '2p' | awk '{print $2 $3}'`
DRIVERS_BASE="/cygdrive/${DRIVE_LETTER,,}/${WINDOWS_FOLDER}"

# Generate the folder structure
MANUF=`wmic computersystem get manufacturer | sed -n '2p' | sed 's/[ \t]*$//' | sed 's/ /_/g'`
MODEL=`wmic computersystem get model | sed -n '2p' | sed 's/[ \t]*$//' | sed 's/ /_/g'`
if [ ! -a "${DRIVERS_BASE}/${MANUF}/${MODEL}" ]; then
	mkdir -p "${DRIVERS_BASE}/${MANUF}/${MODEL}"
fi

path=`pwd`
mkdir Drivers
winpath=`cygpath -ws "$path"'\'Drivers`

# Extract the drivers
./ddc.exe b /target:$winpath
cp -an Drivers/* "${DRIVERS_BASE}/${MANUF}/${MODEL}"
tree Drivers/

# Finally unmount the network share
net use /DELETE ${DRIVE_LETTER}:

description: Extract device drivers to Pulse server share (please edit to configure)
name: Extract drivers
